meanings.definition: The feeling of being unhappy or annoyed.
meanings.sent1: Her displeasure was evident when she received a low grade on the test.
meanings.sent2: His displeasure at having to wait in line was clear from his frown.
meanings.sent3: The cat's displeasure at being bathed was quite comical.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds gathered, mirroring the growing displeasure in the room.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's displeasure could be felt by all the students in the silent classroom.

meanings.definition: To cause someone to feel unhappy or annoyed.
meanings.sent1: Please do not displeasure your sister by hiding her favorite toy.
meanings.sent2: The loud noise from the construction work displeasured the residents of the neighborhood.
meanings.sent3: His attempt at a joke only served to displeasure his friends.
meanings.sent4: The constant delays began to displeasure even the most patient travelers.
meanings.sent5: The harsh criticism from the judge displeasured the contestants on the show.
